supported

is a

support

to

It doesn't yet, but I guess I could. The server is a third party
application
that I downloaded and use, so I don't want to play with their source.

I was thinking of two ways to kick off the server (any other ideas are
welcome):

A) In the DixieCheck class, if the server is not running, launch it. I
must
   admit, I'm new to Java, so I'm not sure of the appropriate way to do
this
   (start another Java application from inside an app, like C's system()
call).

B) Have the dixiecheck Ant task somehow (how?) set a "property"and then
have
   another Ant task that forks java and runs the mailserver, if the
"property"
   is set (can I do a <java fork="yes" classname="..."
classpath="...">).

Any comments on either of these two? Any other suggestions? Any pointers
on
A and/or B?
